meanings.definition: The action of declaring something to be untrue.
meanings.sent1: Her denial of the accusations was strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent2: His denial of the crime only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent3: In a fit of denial, she insisted the sky was green and the grass was blue.
meanings.sent4: The denial of reality was like trying to hold back a tidal wave with a broom.
meanings.sent5: The denial of facts was as clear as a cloudless sky.

meanings.definition: A refusal to admit the truth or reality of something.
meanings.sent1: Their denial of the problem led to further complications.
meanings.sent2: The patient's denial of their illness delayed proper treatment.
meanings.sent3: His denial of the obvious situation was like pretending a lion was a kitten.
meanings.sent4: The denial of the looming danger was akin to ignoring a storm warning.
meanings.sent5: The denial of the truth was as futile as trying to stop a river with a bucket.

meanings.definition: A statement that something is not true.
meanings.sent1: The denial in his words was evident to all who listened.
meanings.sent2: Her denial of involvement in the incident was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent3: The denial of the facts sounded as convincing as claiming the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: The denial of reality in his speech was like painting a blue sky black.
meanings.sent5: The denial of the statement was as clear as a mirror reflecting the truth.

meanings.definition: The action of refusing to give or grant something.
meanings.sent1: The denial of permission left them feeling frustrated.
meanings.sent2: His denial of the request was met with disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The denial of entry to the club felt like being locked out of a party.
meanings.sent4: The denial of access was like hitting a dead end on a road trip.
meanings.sent5: The denial of the opportunity was as crushing as a door slamming shut.
